docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Joe Wilder was a successful surgeon in New York when he took up painting in 1959. Art soon became a second career, and he began dividing his life between operating room and studio. He retired from surgery in 1985, but today, at 82, he is still painting. His subjects include athletes, race cars, landscapes, seascapes, still lifes and his fellow surgeons, whom, he said, he hopes to ''honor and celebrate.'' The images are from ''Life in the Operating Room: The True World of Surgery,'' which is to be his third art book.

headline.main: From the Easel, A Surgical View

docs.abstract: Drawings from Life in the Operating Room: The True World of Surgery, third book by retired New York surgeon and artist Dr Joe Wilder (M)
